list_definition.definition: (also oak tree) a type of large tree with hard wood

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a clump of six very tall old oak trees.

list_ex_of_english: These might include bats, newts, wild flowers and fine oaks whose existence is affected (or more likely threatened) by the building in question.
Many individual ancient oaks are still to be found in current plantations of conifers, left simply because they were too difficult to remove.

The oak galls are collected, crushed and either boiled or infused in rainwater (or white-wine vinegar).
